fields.description:
Users can use the Jira Issues Macro and the Jira Portlet Macro to pull information from Jira. 

However they are unable to create Jira issues from Confluence. 

It would be nice if they are able to do that. 

See [http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=28118&tstart=0]
fields.summary: Allow users to create Jira issues from Confluence pages.

fields.description: Officlally Supprt [SQL Server 2008|http://www.microsoft.com/sqlserver/2008/en/us/default.aspx].
fields.summary: Officially Support SQL Server 2008
Find which space has a mail account setup

fields.description:
CONF-12856 tracked an issue where inner jars where extracted being deleted during the running of Confluence was causing FileNotFoundExceptions.

The fix involved changing atlassian plugins to allow the caller to specify where the plugins were stored.

This has been applied to 2.9 branch and needs to be ported to trunk
fields.summary: Set Plugin Inner jar Cache directory

fields.description:
If the form submitted to the RSS feed builder fails input validation (either no spaces selected or no content types selected) a {{NullPointerException}} is generated in the logs and the page renders with an empty space list. The input validation errors are reported correctly however.

A typical log error appears as:

{noformat}
opensymphony.xwork.util.CompoundRootAccessor] getProperty Caught an Ognl exception while getting property aggregateOptions
-- url: /confluence/dashboard/doconfigurerssfeed.action | userName: anonymous | action: doconfigurerssfeed | referrer: none
ognl.OgnlException: aggregateOptions [java.lang.NullPointerException]
       at ognl.OgnlRuntime.getMethodValue(OgnlRuntime.java:908)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Validation errors in RSS feed configuration screen results in broken UI widgets and null pointer exceptions in logs

fields.description: The LuceneSmartListManager method {{PerformLuceneQuery}} performs some exception message analysis to determine whether an exception has been raised due to an empty index. This handling assumes the thrown exception actually always returns a String despite the contract indicating that a null may be returned. In this situation a NPE will result, masking the original problem and generating noise in the logs.
fields.summary: Exception message handling in LuceneSmartListManager can result in NullPointerException
Enhancement: Ability to Edit Blog Post Without Changing Modification Date?

fields.description:
In some of our spaces at wikis.sun.com, we noticed that when we try to move a page a javascript error is thrown when the page tree loads.

It looks like this error prevents the page to be highlighted in the tree and that makes it impossible to move the page to a new location.

{noformat}
Error: node is null
Source File: https://wikis.sun.com/s/1325/4/1.0/_/download/resources/confluence.web.resources:page-ordering-tree/tree.js
Line: 80
{noformat}

and

{noformat}
Error: node is null
Source File: https://wikis.sun.com/s/1325/4/1.0/_/download/resources/confluence.web.resources:page-ordering-tree/tree.js
Line: 89
{noformat}

I'm not sure if depth is a factor, but all of the pages that I see right now are 5 or more levels deep in the tree hierarchy.
fields.summary: Javascript errors prevent page moves

fields.description:
I have tried several times over the past few months to try and make changes to our ''Partner Engagement Country Management  (PECM)''. Every time I try to logon to the Wiki I receive an error message: 

Unable to connect to host - Session: Unable to connect to host: learning.central.sun.com..
Contact administrator

I can log into the Wiki perfectly when I am using a Sunray within Sun however I cannot when using my token card via http://sun.net?

Do you know what might be causing this problem?

Thanks

Edward
fields.summary: Cannot Login To Wiki Remotely Using Tokencard
Audio files - user control

fields.description:
Space administrator A  is not in confluence-administrators group and he is an   admin of Space A.

In Space A, that is view restricted to about 20 people, but not including the Space administrator A.

Thus when, he views the restricted page, he gets message about permission violation. Since he is a Space Admin, he can go make a note of all the people with view restrictions for that page, remove them all, and then add them all again, including himself so that he could see the page .
fields.summary: Space admin is stricted from viewing a page, but space admin can remove the restriction.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# On Instance A (tested on Confluence 2.8.2), create a child page under the "Home" page
# Upgrade Instance A to Instance B (an instance of Confluence 2.9) by pointing the Confluence Home Directory to Instance A's existing Home Directory
# On Instance B, edit the child page created in Step 1
# In the Edit Mode, try to move the page to another location

The current page is not highlighted. Manually select the current page in the page tree will yield the cancel icon. Hence, page cannot be moved.

In Firefox, a Javascript error will be returned in the console when the page tree is being rendered:

{noformat}
Error: AJS.PageOrdering.node is null
Source File: http://localhost:8297/s/1415/1/1.0/_/download/resources/confluence.web.resources:page-location-editor/page-location.js
Line: 31
{noformat}

The same problem cannot be reproduced if upgrade is done through [Backup and Restore|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Site+Backup+and+Restore] method.
fields.summary: Children page cannot be moved after upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12865].
  {panel}

This idea was suggested by a customer in the [Confluence Community|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Relevant+Notifications] space.

It would be cool if the user could choose which spaces to include in the daily report email from Confluence. For example if I decided that the content in HR was of interest to me, I should be able to optionally add that space to the list of spaces that are of interest to me, so that they are included in the digest and recently updated page (but not being watched, b/c I don't need so many immediate emails). 

In summary you should be able to opt for a daily email report which only includes your favourite spaces.

I understand that this is already possible with the RSS feed builder but some people just prefer email.
fields.summary: Generate a daily email report for your favourite spaces

fields.description:
In an environment where there is thousands of pages, the PageNotFound action is extremely CPU intensive when the alternative page search hits many pages.

One such example to be considered is the space home page in an environment with thousands of spaces. If the home page of a space (EXAMPLE) is changed from "Home" to some other page and the URL {{mywiki/display/EXAMPLE/Home}} is visited, the alterative page search will hit every other "Home" page in all of the other spaces. From stack traces it appears that this operation will spend much time in the permission checking code path, triggering constant Hibernate session flushes to the DB.

Such operations may last tens of minutes in production environments and are often exacerbated when frustrated users constantly click refresh in an attempt to elicit a response from the application.

The options are to limit the number of alternatives we propose (useful in a general sense anyway, 2000 alternatives is not really helpful) and/or reduce the cost of permission checks in this case.

h4. Patch available

To apply the patch (tested in Confluence 2.6 and later):

1. Shut down Confluence
2. Find the file {{alternativepages.vm}} in the pages/ directory of your Confluence application. Replace it with the [attached version|^alternativepages.vm].
3. Find the file {{xwork.xml}} in the WEB-INF/classes/ directory of your Confluence application. Find the following lines in the file:

{code:xml}
<action name="pagenotfound" class="com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.PageNotFoundAction">
    <result name="error" type="dispatcher">/fourohfour.action</result>
    <result name="success" type="velocity">/pages/alternativepages.vm</result>
</action>
{code}

Change the class in the first line to "com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceActionSupport" as shown below:

{code:xml}
<action name="pagenotfound" class="com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceActionSupport">
    <result name="error" type="dispatcher">/fourohfour.action</result>
    <result name="success" type="velocity">/pages/alternativepages.vm</result>
</action>
{code}

4. Start Confluence again. The "Page not found" page should now load quickly, irrespective of how many spaces are in the instance.
fields.summary: PageNotFound action can render Confluence inoperable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12861].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have possibility to add labels to user profiles. This would make People Directory more usable and could help project teams to list their users in project pages if User macros would support this new feature.

Use case:
My team members would add label *myteam* to their user profiles (from pre-populated list or create new ones). If I now want to browse all users in my team I could to it in People Directory selecting *myteam*-label from pre-populated list (e.g. like labels are show in Spaces). I could also add User-plugin to my project page showing all users with *myteam*-label.

This would make possible to use Confluence as a company's facebook as there could be pages showing all users belonging to floorball-team, movie club and so on.

The ultimate goal of this would be making Confluence even more interesting and spur people to write in their personal pages and of course in other spaces, too.
fields.summary: Possibility to use team-labels for Users

fields.description:
If the id of a page is known by a user, that user can view the content of the page without having permissions to the space it is in. They need only construct the right URL.
EG:
Two spaces A and B
Page with id 1 is in Space A
Page with id 2 is in Space B
User cannot see Space A
User can see Space B

The following URL will allow the user to view a diff of the two pages, thus easily deriving the content of the page in the hidden space.

{noformat}
http://confluence.example.com/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=2&originalId=1
{noformat}
fields.summary: Hidden pages' content can be viewed without permission using diffpages.action

fields.description:
If the id of a page is known by a user, that user can view the content of the page without having permissions to the space it is in.  They need only construct the right URL.

The following URL will allow the user to copy the page to space B and view its content.

fields.description:
The {{PageAware}} interface has a {{isViewPermissionRequired}} method but its not being used.

The {{PageAwareInteceptor}} should be using it and performing a standard view permission check.

In the best case it leads to duplicate checks in most of our actions.
In the worst case it leads to actions with insufficient permission checks which could cause security bugs.
fields.summary: PageAwareInterceptor should be performing VIEW permission check

fields.description:
Some Confluence plugins, such as the Plugin Repository Client, have "inner" jar files.  
Confluence 2.9 opens these in the JVM's temp directory.  
On some systems this defaults to /tmp or another directory that gets routinely cleaned.
It is possible for these jar files to get removed from the temp directory while Confluence is running, and when this happens Confluence has no coping mechanism.  It still expects the jars to be in those locations and the resources to be within them.  When it needs these resources and doesn't find them in those locations it doesn't look anywhere else.

*User Symptoms*
The symptom that has been tied to this problem thus far is that the plugin repository screen works initially, but after Confluence has been up for a while, it starts returning:
{noformat}
org.apache.velocity.exception.ResourceNotFoundException: Unable to find resource '/templates/repositoryFrame.vm'
at com.atlassian.confluence.util.velocity.ConfigurableResourceManager.loadResource(ConfigurableResourceManager.java:400)
{noformat}

*Workarounds*
This error can be resolved by restarting Confluence.
If you change the Java system property java.io.tmpdir to something you know doesn't get regularly cleared, then this should prevent the problem reoccurring.

*Suggested fixes*
We could either rewrite the PluginsClassLoader to be prepared for resources to be deleted while Confluence is up, 
OR
Not load inner jars into java.io.tmpdir
OR
both.
fields.summary: Plugins can lose access to resources in inner jars

We call confluence search using the webservice / soap search api call. Recently we noticed that some of the searches were causing webservice axisfaults. We investigated and found it was because the search results were including high bit characters that resulted in invalid xml. This caused the webservice to fail on your server side. We would see entries like the stack trace listed below in the system out logs.

This appears to be affecting search when called from the confluence site as well. We see cases where not all results are returned. The error on our client that is calling confluence is catastrophic as it causes the webservice to fail with an AxisFault because the returning xml is invalid.

We've seen these "bad" characters in the summary from word docs, but it is also possible that the page itself has the content although I have not found that specific case yet.

h3. Updated Description
Some company policies want to restrict the viewing of a list of users. Thus they would like to disable the people directory and any way to access it. 

h5. Workaround 

Is detailed in this documentation: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Hiding+the+People+Directory

However if you navigate to the profile of a user, and then click on the "People" in the breadcrumb link (Dashboard >> *People* >> FullName >> Profile) or you go to the URL directly {{<CONFLUENCE_INSTALL>/browsepeople.action}}, you will be able to access the people directory. 

To workaround this, set up Apache webserver in front of confluence and redirect requests to this URL.

fields.description:
Cache tuning should be more automated; when a cache size needs to increase, the cache admin page should provide a recommended value (and an easy way to enter it).

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 18 Oct 2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,
Thanks for your votes for this issue. The Confluence team had spent some time attempting to provide a recommended cache setting in the admin user interface. After careful consideration, we have come to the conclusion that this is something we cannot implement. Despite our efforts, we came to understand there is no cheep, automated, accurate method to provide cache size recommendations.

There are several factors that input into providing an effective cache recommendation strategy. These are: 
* Memory size allocation
Simply increasing the cache size could lead to more memory usage and an increase in full garbage collections performed by the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). This could consequently lead to even worse performance.
* Selective cache tuning
Some memory caches are more important than others. Changing those that are used more extensively would provide more benefits. This should be done through a manual tuning process. 
* Other cache considerations 
** Size of an object stored inside a cache should be considered when recommending the size.
** Cache entries expiry time.
* The tuning process 
When changing cache it is important to check how the change affected hit/miss/usage - It's important to keep an eye on the performance of the application after the cache sizes have been changed (see [related documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Cache+Performance+Tuning#CachePerformanceTuning-CacheTuningFollowUp]) - there is no cheap way to automate this.

We recommend that all customers spend some time going through our [Cache Performance Tuning|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Cache+Performance+Tuning] documentation and conduct a manual tuning process - there is no hard and fast rule to solve this problem.

Sherif Mansour
Atlassian Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Provide recommendations for caches in the UI

fields.description: Currently the cache tuning process is cumbersome. It requires digging up the class name of the cache, placing it in two separate spots in an xml file, and restarting Confluence. It should be controllable from the UI.

fields.description:
Hi,

we use several global templates throughout all the confluence spaces and recognized an error in the {toc} macro for these global templates. Steps to (hopefully) reproduce this problem:

* In the administration interface, *global* templates, click _add template_.
* enter a {toc} macro on ton, some headlines,  some text, and some variable fields inside the headlines into the body of template A).
* press preview. The preview works, but the {toc} marco fails, which is not nice but not the problem here.
* press save.
* Add another *global* template B) with a {toc} macro, and some headlines/text/whatever.
* Press preview. 
* *Now, in the preview you should see the generated TOC content of template A), not B), as I would expect.*

This wrong TOC content is also display when I use template B) to create a page. As variables are included in headlines, confluence also expects the user to fill in the variables in the headlines inside the TOC, which aren't even there to fill anything in template B).
fields.summary: {toc} macro in preview and variable insertion for global templates shows wrong headlines

fields.description: This is a function I've seen in a different product that was incredibly useful.  Bascially, it allows a developer to authenticate a user session on behalf of X user without having access to X user's password.  The api takes three parameters:  admin user name, admin user password, and the user name of user X, the user to be impersonated in this session.  This allows applications outside Confluence ... portlets, for example ... to perform Confluence tasks on the balf of users without having assess to a user's Confluence password and without worrying that the external application will show content or perform functions that the user does not have permissions for.

fields.description:
The "suggested database indexes" on this page suggest BITMAP indexes on the STATUS and CONTENTTYPE columns of the CONTENT table:

   http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF29/Improving+Database+Performance

Oracle bitmap indexes can lock several thousand rows of the table when they're being updated. This has been a big problem since (a) most write activity on the CONTENT table are inserts or deletes, which inevitably update the index, and (b) writes to the CONTENT table are much more frequent since we added drafts and auto-save.

We need to revisit these recommendations, especially for high volume instances.
fields.summary: Bitmapped indexes in Oracle may cause high contention and deadlocks in high volume instances

  {panel}

The WSDL is not web service 1.0 compliant. (per standards @ http://www.w3.org/2002/ws/) 
We had to modify the WSDL in order to get our systems working with it. I have attached a modified WSDL file we are using)

On SOAP web services Login request:

What is expected - 

  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
- <loginResponse xmlns="https://wiki.mydomainname.com/rpc/soap-axis/confluenceservice-v1">
     <loginReturn xmlns="">loginReturn</loginReturn>
  </loginResponse>


What is actually coming back -

  <?xml version="1.0" ?> 
- <ns1:loginResponse xmlns:ns1="http://soap.rpc.confluence.atlassian.com" xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
  <loginReturn xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="xsd:string">qy28AM7WOw</loginReturn> 
  </ns1:loginResponse>
fields.summary: Remote API Generates non-Web Services compliant (W3C) responses at login using WSDL

fields.description:
Author-based search does not work correctly if you change the author for whom you are searching.

To reproduce:
# Perform a search for a particular text string (e.g. "network") for a particular user (e.g. "khertzer")
# Change the value in the "Who" field to another user (e.g. "sfitts")
# Click the "Search" button with the mouse

The results in the search query will be the wiki documents containing "network" for the user "khertzer," and not the user "sfitts."

While the HTTP parameter contributor is automatically updated (so that the "Who" field is filled in correctly), the HTTP parameter for contributorUsername is not updated to correspond to the username for the person listed in the "Who" field. In my case, the URL looks like this:
http://jdibble-desktop:9999/dosearchsite.action?queryString=network&where=conf_all&type=&lastModified=&contributor=Sean+Fitts+%28sfitts%29&contributorUsername=khertzer

However, it should look like this:
http://jdibble-desktop:9999/dosearchsite.action?queryString=network&where=conf_all&type=&lastModified=&contributor=Sean+Fitts+%28sfitts%29&contributorUsername=sfitts

Note that this problem only occurs if you click the "Search" button with the mouse. If, instead, you hit the Enter key to select the default (search) button, then the contributorUsername is populated correctly and the search returns the correct results.
fields.summary: Author-based search: Clicking on Search button after changing "Who" field does not update contributorUsername parameter in URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12780].
  {panel}

I was actually confused about comments and permalinking until a few minutes ago.

Here's the technique I'd like to see happen with Confluence permalinked comments:

http://www.37signals.com/svn/archives/000558.php

And I'd prefer a *deep yellow* background - almost unreadable, if necessary - or maybe a *deep blue* background - something that _really_ grabs your eyes so you can focus in on the comment you're looking for. We already provide two different colors for our comments, so a highlight color that grabs your attention needs to really be ridiculously eye-catching.

And, this is still not an ideal solution. For instance, I open a lot of new tabs through links - hopefully the fade effect would not kick in until I actually looked at that tab for the first time - often, I open the tab 'in the background' without immediately switch over to view it.

Basically, I thought comment permalinks were broken - I thought we needed to provide a lot of whitespace at the bottom of each page, but I guess this is the new way to do it. I probably would not have been as confused if we really highlighted the comment I was heading to.

Use Javascript to highlight selected comment on permalinks
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11903

Example link:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Known+Issues+for+Resin+3.x?focusedCommentId=147187#comment-147187
fields.summary: Provide 'The Yellow Fade' Technique for permalinked comments to improve readability/usability

fields.description:
The JIRA Portlet macro still breaks breadcrumbs.
See the following pages:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Portlet+Macro
http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DOCTST/JIRA+Portlet+Macro

This issue is reported as fixed for 2.9 --- see http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-12042 and http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CONFJIRA-60
But it still seems to be broken.
fields.summary: JIRA Portlet Macro still breaks Breadcrumbs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12773].
  {panel}

In the past we allow user to save a page with up to 100,000 characters.

As there isn't any check on the size, if a user is saving a page bigger than 100,000 characters the database would throw an integrity constraint error.

Now we make the size bigger (2GB) so there isn't an arbitrary limit and to prevent large page save from throwing an error.

While it is very unlikely a page will get to that size, big pages could create a performance problem.

We need to implement a better check (page size limitation) and a better error message to advise the user if they have breached the page size limit.
fields.summary: Limit for page size: amount of text that can be saved in a page
